title: Fairlight Cycles Alex McCormack’s Holt 2.0 Prototype
content:
One of Fairlight Cycles‘ team riders Alex McCormack won the Hellenic Mountain Race last month, finishing the race in 3 days 4 hours 31 minutes and beat last year’s time by 17 hours. He was racing on a Holt 2.0. The frame was completely raw and pulled straight off the production line in Taiwan and shipped out to Alex to be built up. Let’s take a closer look at the the Holt 2.0…

Fairlight Holt 2.0 Quick Hits

  • New 853 seat tube developed with Reynolds. Designed by Fairlight. Compatible with a 30.9mm seat post but only 3g heavier [on a size Medium] than the previous 27.2mm version. Yep, 3g!
  • All new rear triangle. Chainstays and seatstays are heavily curved and flat ovalized — maximising compliance.
  • Slightly dropped top tube for increased stand-over height. Seat tube lengths stay the same for good seat post insertion.
  • No bosses for gear cables on the drive-side chainstay – super clean with wireless setups. Fairlight has designed a 3D-printed chainstay sleeve that will route mechanical gear cables. The chainstay protector is not shown in the photos.
  • Bentley x Fairlight CNC Utility Drops II. A modular dropout design. T-Type compatible. Built-in real estate to [hopefully] work with future standards. Fairlight is still working on the stainless steel washer plates, so these working prototypes use countersunk washers. Get the dimensions and function correct, and then focus on elegance.

Holt 2.0 Geometry

The Holt 2.0 features a 0.5º steeper seat angle and approximately 10 mm longer reach. There were no changes to head angle – it was extremely clear from all our riders that this should not change. As such, it remains at 67.5º sagged with a 110mm fork (67 with 120).

Alex’s Holt 2.0 Build Spec:

  • Frame: Fairlight Holt 2.0 Large.
  • Fork: Fox 34 SL 110mm
  • Wheels: DT Swiss XMC 1200
  • Tyres: Vittoria Mezcal 2.35 (XC insert in rear)
  • Sealant: Stans Race
  • Crankset: Quarq XX1 170mm
  • BB: Hope T47
  • Groupset: SHIMANO XTR m9100
  • Pedals: SHIMANO XTR m9100
  • Seatpost: OneUp V2 210mm
  • Saddle: Selle Itallia S3 Boost 3D
  • Seatclamp: Hope
  • Headset: Chris King InSet
  • Stem: Profile Design 70mm -12º
  • Bars: Truvativ Atmos 780mm
  • Inner bar end: SQlab 411
  • Grips: Ergon GA3
  • Brakes: SHIMANO XTR m9100 4 Pot
  • Bags: Tailfin

As for the Holt 2.0 release, stay tuned and keep an eye on Fairlight Cycles.
